content:
Create a Conversation Intelligence rule to trigger an action when an agent or customer speaks or types a keyword on the phone or in a message. Sample actions include sending notifications to a supervisor and an agent, displaying recommendations to agents, and running processes in the background.

Keyword detection works when the agent and customer are both on the call or participating in the message. Conversation Intelligence detects keywords using a case-insensitive, exact match method.

When a keyword is matched, the recordId and a list of matched keywords are passed to the Next Best Action or autolaunched flow.

To create a rule, click New, enter the rule details, select an action, and add one or more keywords. You can select from Update Next Best Action, Run Autolaunched Flow, Alert Supervisor, or Alert Agent and Supervisor as actions.

In the Trigger Type field, select Matching keyword and choose to detect keywords by Customer, Agent, or Either. Add up to 25 keywords with a 255-character limit each. Save the rule.
title: Triggering Actions with Conversation Intelligence
